page.title: 10THE RAILWAY STATION
page.content: { Wymondham Railway Station}is small,with 2 platforms, and is not manned. A number of the buildings are let to outside firms and the platform windows are covered with plywood. It is part of the Breckland line, and therefore one of the many stops between Norwich and Cambridge. The Norwich to Liverpool Street trains sometimes stop at Wymondham. The Norwich to Birmingham train passes through but does not stop. The station is used mostly for shunting, where trucks collect Super Shell, Grain and Cement from Whitemore, March and return them to Wymondham for distribution. Shunting times are 7.15 - 8.30 a.m. and 2.45 - 5.00 p.m. daily. There is a manually operated Signal Box, where three local men work in shifts.
